descript.abstract: This dataset provides information on fixed-route transit stops for the State of Washington as of 7/1/17. Stop data was primarily extracted from General Transit Feed Specification (GTFS) data. In the case of Grant Transit Authority, GTFS data was not available as of the time of publishing so stops were identified manually based on information from the Grant Transit website and Google Maps. Because GTFS data is typically created and managed by each individual transit agency, WSDOT cannot guarantee the accuracy of this data.
descript.purpose: Fixed-route transit stops for the State of Washington.

idinfo.useconst: The Washington State Department of Transportation shall not be liable for any activity involving this data with regard to lost profits or savings or any other consequential damages; or the fitness for use of the data for a particular purpose; or the installation of the data, its use, or the results obtained.

srcinfo.srccontr: Publicly-available GTFS feeds were acquired from TransitLand (https://transit.land/), TransitFeeds (http://transitfeeds.com/), and agency websites. All other GTFS feeds were acquired directly from transit agencies.

procstep.procdesc:
An automated Python script was developed that:
1) Downloads the most recent GTFS zip files available 2) Extracts data tables and loads into a MySQL database 3) Queries stop data and joins with route information, agency name, and last update fields 4) Concatenates stop information for duplicate stop locations 5) Exports stop data to ArcGIS shapefile

mapproj.mapprojn: NAD 1983 HARN StatePlane Washington South FIPS 4602 Feet

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Name of the transit agency serving the stop
"stop_id" from the stops.txt file in each agency's GTFS feed. Stop IDs are unique to each agency, but not unique across the entire dataset.
"stop_name" from the stops.txt file in each agency's GTFS feed.
The routes serving each stop, separated by semicolons. "route_short_name" from routes.txt in each agency's GTFS feed. In instances where no "route_short_name" existed, "route_long_name" was used.

Most recent modified date for any .txt file within each agency's GTFS feed. Since stop location data does not necessarily change frequently, it is assumed that stop information is up-to-date as of the most recent update to the GTFS feed itself.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
